title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 5 of 8)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using vertical-slice strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Automated Match Score Calculation
buildSequence.summary: Implements automated match score calculation triggered after daily job scraping completion. Processes jobs in controlled batches of 10 with resource management and comprehensive error handling.
testableOutcomes: Match scoring process automatically initiates within 5 minutes after daily job scraping completes
System processes newly scraped jobs in batches of exactly 10 jobs per batch with 1-second delays
All successfully processed jobs have match scores between 0.0 and 1.0 stored in database
System skips jobs with missing data and logs issues without stopping batch processing
CPU usage remains below 80% and memory usage below 75% during batch processing
Process log entries track start/end timestamps, job counts, and performance metrics for each execution

deliverables: Database migration for match scoring process logs

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Integrates with existing hybrid match scoring algorithm. Requires careful resource monitoring and batch size optimization. Consider database connection pooling for batch operations.

buildSequence.title: Circuit Breaker System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive circuit breaker system for scraper reliability. Provides automatic failure detection, 1-hour cooldown periods, health checks, and graceful degradation when platforms are unavailable.
testableOutcomes: Circuit breaker opens and prevents further attempts after 3 consecutive scraper failures
Circuit breaker enforces 1-hour cooldown period before allowing any retry attempts
Circuit breaker transitions to half-open state after cooldown and performs single health check
Successful health check in half-open state closes circuit breaker and resumes normal operations
Failed health check in half-open state reopens circuit breaker and restarts cooldown period
Search results display available platform data with clear notifications about unavailable sources
System displays cached job listings with unavailability messages when all scrapers are down

deliverables: Database migration for circuit breaker state tracking
Enhanced scraper base class with circuit breaker integration

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Critical system reliability component requiring careful state management and persistence. Must integrate with all existing scrapers without breaking changes. Consider Redis for distributed circuit breaker state if scaling horizontally.

buildSequence.title: Circuit Breaker State Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements independent circuit breaker state management for each job platform scraper. Ensures platform failures are isolated and don't affect other scrapers' availability.
testableOutcomes: Each job platform scraper maintains independent circuit breaker state with separate failure counts
RemoteOK scraper circuit breaker opens after 3 failures while Indeed scraper remains operational
System status endpoint returns individual circuit breaker states for all configured platforms
Circuit breaker state persistence survives service restarts and maintains per-platform isolation

deliverables: Database migration for platform-specific circuit breaker states

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Must ensure thread-safe state management across concurrent scraper operations. Platform identification should be consistent across all scraper instances.

buildSequence.title: Retry Logic System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive retry logic with exponential backoff, error classification, and configurable retry limits. Handles transient failures gracefully while avoiding unnecessary retries for permanent errors.
testableOutcomes: System retries transient failures (5xx, timeout, connection errors) with exponential backoff: 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s
System caps retry delays at 30 seconds maximum regardless of exponential calculation
System immediately returns success on any successful retry attempt without additional delays
System does not retry 4xx client errors and returns failure immediately
System respects configurable maximum retry count with default of 3 attempts
System logs each retry attempt with attempt number, delay duration, and error classification

deliverables: Enhanced base scraper classes with retry integration

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Error classification must be accurate to prevent infinite retry loops. Backoff calculation should handle edge cases like system clock changes. Integration with circuit breaker must prevent conflicts.

buildSequence.title: Job Dashboard UI
buildSequence.summary: Implements the main job dashboard interface with card-based layout, match score display, technology tags, and salary information. Provides responsive design and progressive loading for optimal user experience.
testableOutcomes: Dashboard displays jobs in responsive card layout with multiple cards per row on desktop, single column on mobile
Empty state message appears when no jobs are available with appropriate call-to-action
Progressive loading triggers when scrolling near bottom, loading additional job cards seamlessly
Match scores display as color-coded percentages: green (70-100%), yellow (40-69%), red (0-39%)
Technology tags show maximum 5 technologies with '+X more' expandable indicator for additional skills
Salary information displays in format '$X - $Y per year' with currency symbols and 'not disclosed' fallback
Matching technologies between user profile and job requirements are visually highlighted on cards
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Performance optimization crucial for large job datasets. Virtual scrolling may be needed for thousands of jobs. Match score color coding should be accessible for colorblind users.

buildSequence.title: Job Dashboard Actions & Sorting
buildSequence.summary: Implements quick action buttons on job cards (Save, Apply, View Details) with dynamic state management and job sorting capabilities by match percentage, posting date, and salary. Provides intuitive controls for job management and prioritization.
testableOutcomes: Job cards display Save, Apply, and View Details buttons with appropriate styling and hover states
Save button changes to 'Saved' state with visual confirmation when clicked and job is added to saved jobs
Apply button redirects to external job posting URL or internal application process when clicked
View Details button opens job detail page with complete job information when clicked
Applied jobs show disabled Apply button with 'Applied' status text
Sort by Match % orders jobs from highest to lowest match score with unscored jobs at end
Sort direction toggle reverses job order for match percentage sorting
Sort by Date orders jobs from most recent to oldest posting date with undated jobs at end
Sort by Salary orders jobs from highest to lowest salary using maximum value for ranges
Current sort option is visually highlighted in sort dropdown menu
Posting date is visible on job cards when sorted by date

deliverables: Job actions and sorting test suite

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on responsive button layouts and smooth state transitions. Ensure sorting performance with large job datasets. Implement optimistic UI updates for better user experience.

buildSequence.title: Dashboard Filtering UI
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive job filtering interface with salary range, technology, location, remote work, company, and job level filters. Provides advanced filtering capabilities with search, multi-select, and dynamic result updates to help users find relevant job opportunities.
testableOutcomes: Salary filter displays minimum and maximum input fields with currency formatting
Jobs with salary >= minimum threshold are displayed when minimum salary filter is applied
Jobs with salary <= maximum threshold are displayed when maximum salary filter is applied
Jobs without salary information are excluded when any salary filter is active
Technology filter displays searchable multi-select dropdown with alphabetically sorted options
Jobs matching ANY selected technology are displayed when multiple technologies are selected
Location filter provides city/region search with autocomplete suggestions
Remote Only filter displays only fully remote positions when selected
Hybrid filter shows jobs with hybrid work arrangements when applied
Company size filter (startup, mid-size, enterprise) filters jobs by company category
Specific company search allows selection of individual companies with autocomplete
Job level filter (junior, mid, senior, lead) displays only jobs at selected levels
Multiple filters combine with AND logic to show jobs matching all criteria
Filter combinations update results dynamically without page refresh

deliverables: Enhanced useJobFilters.ts with all filter types
Enhanced filter-engine.ts with advanced filtering logic

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex filter combinations require careful query optimization. Implement debounced search for performance. Consider filter state persistence across sessions. Ensure mobile-responsive filter interface.

buildSequence.title: Filter Management UI
buildSequence.summary: Implements active filter display with removable tags, clear all functionality, and result count display. Provides users with clear visibility of applied filters and easy management of complex filter combinations.
testableOutcomes: Active filters display as removable tags above job list with clear visual styling
Clicking filter tag removes that specific filter and updates results immediately
Clear All Filters button removes all active filters and displays all jobs
Job count displays 'X jobs found' message reflecting current filter criteria
Empty state shows 'No jobs match your criteria' message when no results found
Empty state includes suggestion to adjust filters with actionable guidance
Filter tags show appropriate labels for each filter type (salary, technology, location, etc.)
Filter management area is responsive and works on mobile devices

deliverables: Enhanced ActiveFilters.tsx with complete filter management
Enhanced useFilterState.ts with clear all functionality
Filter management styling and responsive CSS

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on intuitive filter tag design and smooth removal animations. Ensure clear visual hierarchy between active filters and results. Implement proper accessibility for screen readers.

buildSequence.title: Job Detail Page
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive job detail page with full job information, requirements checklist with match status, and detailed gap analysis. Provides complete view of job opportunity with personalized matching insights.
testableOutcomes: Job detail page displays complete job title, company name, location, and posting date in dedicated information section
Full untruncated job description appears with preserved formatting when user scrolls to description section
Missing metadata fields show 'Not specified' placeholder text or are hidden from display
Requirements checklist displays all identified job requirements categorized by skills, experience, education, and certifications
Each requirement shows visual indicator (green checkmark for match, red X for missing, yellow warning for partial) based on user profile comparison
Clicking any requirement item reveals additional details explaining match status determination
Overall match percentage score displays prominently in gap analysis section
Missing requirements appear as prioritized list ranked by importance to the role
Gap analysis includes specific suggestions for addressing each missing requirement
High match percentage (>80%) displays encouraging messaging highlighting strong role fit
Low match percentage (<50%) shows constructive feedback about significant gaps
Section navigation menu remains sticky at top and updates active tab based on scroll position
Navigation adapts to mobile-friendly collapsible menu format on mobile devices
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires integration with existing matching algorithms and gap analysis engines. Complex responsive design for mobile navigation. Performance optimization needed for large job descriptions and requirements lists.

buildSequence.title: Job Detail Content Generation Views
buildSequence.summary: Adds cover letter variants and tailored CV preview sections to job detail page. Integrates with existing content generation services to display personalized application materials.
testableOutcomes: Cover letter section displays at least 3 different variants with distinct style labels (professional, creative, technical)
Each cover letter variant shows preview of first paragraph and brief description of tone and approach
Clicking expand on cover letter variant reveals full text with proper formatting and job-specific personalization
Cover letter variants incorporate relevant keywords from job posting and highlight different qualification aspects
Selected cover letter provides options to copy to clipboard, download as PDF, or edit content
Cover letter generation in progress shows loading state with estimated completion time
Tailored CV section displays visual preview of CV formatted specifically for the job posting
Tailored CV shows relevant skills and experiences prominently featured and reordered to match job priorities
Job-specific keywords from posting are naturally incorporated into experience descriptions in tailored CV
Tailored CV highlights modified sections compared to base CV with visual indicators
Tailored CV preview provides options to download as PDF, make manual edits, or revert to original
CV tailoring in progress displays loading state with progress indication and estimated completion time
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Depends on AI service availability and response times. Requires careful handling of generation failures and loading states. PDF generation and editing functionality adds complexity.
